Topic 10 Rules of Differentiation 10.1 Derivatives of Familiar Functions 10.2 Arithmetic Rules for Derivatives 10.3 Product Rule 10.4 Quotient Rule 10.5 Chain Rule

Topic 10 Rules of Differentiation 10.1 Derivatives of Familiar Functions \(\frac{d}{dx}(c)= 0\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(mx+b)= m\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(x^n)=n x^{n-1}\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(\sqrt{x})= \frac{1}{2} x^{-1/2}\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(e^x)=e^x\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(\ln(x))=\frac{1}{x}\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(a^{x})= \ln(a) \, a^x\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(\log_a(x))= \frac{1}{x \, \ln(a)}\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(\sin(x))= \cos(x)\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(\cos(x))= -\sin(x)\) 10.2 Arithmetic Rules for Derivatives \(\frac{d}{dx}(f(x)+g(x))= f'(x) + g'(x)\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(f(x)-g(x)) = f'(x) - g'(x)\) \(\frac{d}{dx}(cf(x))= c f'(x)\) 10.3 Product Rule \[\frac{d}{dx}(f(x)\cdot g(x))= f'(x) g(x) + f(x)g'(x)\] 10.4 Quotient Rule \[\frac{d}{dx}\left(\frac{f(x)}{g(x)}\right)= \frac{g(x) f'(x) - f(x)g'(x)}{(g(x))^2}\] 10.5 Chain Rule \[ \frac{d}{dx} (f(g(x)) = f'(g(x)) g'(x) \]
